contextId.information: The official uses this question to explain what he thought would happen. It can be a statement. AT: "He does not want to see you looking worse than the other young men of your own age." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: Why should he see you looking worse than the other young men of your own age?

contextId.information: The king does not expect an answer. He is threatening the three men. AT: "No god is able to rescue you from my power!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: Who is the god ... my hands?

contextId.information: Daniel asks this question meaning that he cannot speak to the angel because he is not the angel's equal. These sentences can be combined. AT: "I am not able to answer you because I am only your servant" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: I am your servant. How can I talk with my master?
